Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Oliver H
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Omm in April. The hotel is located very centrally in Barcelona, with many of the shops and tourist attractions within easy walking distance. The rooms are excellent, very clean, very modern, and very well proportioned. I have two negatives from my stay. The first is the hotel gym. I wouldn’t call this a gym, in fact I've seen home gyms with more equipment. One treadmill, one bike and a few weights is pretty poor. The second is the hotel staff in the lobby bar/restaurant. Serving customers seemed to be the last thing they wanted to do. On both days I had breakfast in the hotel I had to practically force the waiter to give me my bill. Overall a lovely hotel, but for both exercise and breakfast, I recommend you leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Edwardfreedman
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly, understand what you are looking for such as restaurants, good advice. Food in the bar area very good, the restaurant has a very good reputation, very well deserved, an experiance that should be tried at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: m64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend in January and had a fantastic time. It was our 1st time to Barcelona and found it easy to navigate our way to the hotel using the subway. It's just off one of the main streets down to the beach and has a whole host of shops and restaurants around it. Inside the foyer is very trendy and spacious with Moo restuarant in view. The hotel staff were friendly and able to see to our every wish. The room was a good size for a city hotel with a well thought out studio feel to it. At the hotel bar and restaurant the waiters are very good at their job. It's a very happening spot in the city yet they make you feel very welcome. I would definately recommend this as a great resting spot to see all Barcelona has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: StephanJudge
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded at arrival - good start. Lobby is gorgeous, feels like a cozy living room. Room was huge, clean, the bed comfy. I really enjoyed the spa (which I had all to myself for Saturday afternoon, was empty). Staff were friendly, the food and wine great, and all at a super central location. I will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, elegant, brilliant location. Not like a four seasons but very cool all the same”
Reviews.Author: SuchiPatel
Reviews.Content: Suberb hotel as part of our long weekend to Barcelona. Brilliant location in the eixample district which is very classy. Very helpful staff. We went to the Michelin Moo restaurant in the hotel which was fantastic... Especially if you're a food and wine sort of person like my husband and I! Rooms had a brilliant ultra modern deco and feel to it however the finish isn't the greatest. Beds are sooooo comfy, could hardly get up in the mornings! Best long weekend in a long time!

Reviews.Title: “el sitio ideal para unos dias en barcelona”
Reviews.Author: hanneloreIbiza
Reviews.Content: i stayed 3 nights at the Omm and have nothing to complain about. the welcome at reception was friendly and correct, the room spacious , light and comfortable. i made use of the spa which i found a bit too dark for my liking, but with pleasant service.... the breakfast is served in the big entrance hall which i enjoyed very much. the situation is very central. lots of good restaurants and interessting shops nearby... for me the perfect place to stay for a few days in barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: gordolondon
Reviews.Content: I took my wife there for her 40th last weekend and we loved it. A beautiful hotel; different, stylish; good sized rooms are a big advantage of Omm; fantastic helpful, kind service from everyone; location is second to none - its on the 'Tourist Bus' route, central to the cathedral, park, shops and sea. And we ate at Moo (off a la carte menu) which lived up to the hype and price was very reasonable. We'd recommend Omm to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: WilliamB123
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel through the Design hotels. And Its really design hotel. Lobby and room was very nice. Spa was very very cool. Location is the best. Its very closed to all fashion stores and architectural structures of Gauidi. I will go there as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great sleep!”
Reviews.Author: verdell2010
Reviews.Content: Just back from a very pleasant stay in Hotel Omm. Fabulous location, with lovely restaurants nearby, less than a 1 minute walk to the nearest metro, and a nice 15 minute stroll down to Las Rambas. The rooms are gorgeous, and the beds, along with the black out blinds, made for a great nights rest! The only small problem I had was the toilet being seperate to the main bathroom, you had to walk across the room to wash your hands. Other than that, the room was gorgeous. I would avoid the breakfast here, at €25 you'll be disappointed! You're better off heading out to one of the cafes nearby. They do great offers, where you can get a coffee, sandwich & juice for just €3.25! The staff were lovely - however, with the lift being right beside the reception desk, you have to walk right by to get in and out of the hotel. They do like to watch everything!!! The lobby area is fab, full of comfortable chunky sinkable sofas, and if you're frightened by the price of a gin and tonic (€15!!!!) you can get a nice glass of beer for €3, which comes with a small bowl of crisps, so you can get that 5 star feel, without shelling out! It really is a fabulous spot & I'll most definately head back.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: KevinMcCullagh
Reviews.Content: My wife, 18 month son and I stayed here twice before and after Xmas, and absolutely loved it. The location is perfect for Gaudi, shopping and good restaurants, but what really marks this hotel out is the rare combination of style and service. The rooms are beautifully thought through and exquisitely detailed, right down to CDs with music you actually want to listen to. The staff were welcoming, helpful and good humoured. The spa environment and service is pretty special too – very oommm. In a perfect world the quality of the cocktails and coffee would also meet Omm's standards elsewhere, but this is a small gripe.

Reviews.Title: “guess are stolen things and hotel couldn't care less”
Reviews.Author: travelaroundtheclock
Reviews.Content: We were in the restaurant, nobody except the unattentative and arrogant waiters got near our table and my handbag was stolen from under the table - iphone, camera and other stuff for 2000 EUR gone. The duty manager claimed that CCTV will show, but it did not. I asked for news and all I received in return was some legal disclaimer '... not liable... blabla... this is spain'... what a joke, all I was expecting an apology and this is what I get. Not even a word like 'we are sorry that this happened to you' or anything similar.... How unprofessional and careless towards clients they are. I gave them two chances to make it good and told them that I would post it on tripadvisor, they ignored it and failed again and so I am forced to write here to warn others: If you need to go to that place, keep your property closer than on the Ramblas as the hotel has absolutely no interest in protecting you or your property. My friends are repeaters in that hotel, they brought us there and they had to witness all that, they will never again overnight in the hotel - not due to the fact that I was stolen things, but due the failure of the hotel reacting to it in a client oriented way.

Reviews.Title: “Chic!”
Reviews.Author: Anjuaradhya
Reviews.Content: What a chic hotel and conveniently located to reach all the attractions of this beautiful city! The Spa is a must! Fabulous facilities for the guests! Very modern! Excellent food...except for Breakfast as there seems to be more non-vegetarian dishes offered, even in the morning! Receptionists are extremely helpful in pointing out the local attractions! We went to a very good performance of Flamenco, dance is thrilling, but the included dinner was awful! Don't waste your money on buying a ticket with Dinner!! But watch the dance for sure! Passionate!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of good..”
Reviews.Author: weepinwillow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Omm for 3 nights in October..The hotel was very nice and a great location...walking distance to many of the beautiful attractions Barcelona has to offer..and very near Tapas Tapas and Tapas 24 YUMMY..The hotel is modern in design and has a great rooftop deck with a pool. The staff was nice enough..the restaurant was good but way overpriced for what it was. The room had a nice deck, comfortable bed, and a nice deep tub. Though there is a nightclub at the hotel we were never disturbed by the noise. I would not stay here again because of a little booking issue...I accidentally booked for an extra day online..when i tried to cancel and stay 3 nights instead of 4 the reservation manager would not budge..she had the ability to change it and have good customer service but chose not too. We would up having to pay that extra night..I understand it was my error but with so many hotels. customer service is what really sets you apart..It was a very expensive mistake on my part. Also..the walls of the room are paper thin...as we were well aware of our neighbor's intimate details of their evening..ewwww. So..we enjoyed our stay, the room was nice, the food was good..but ...its not the only or best gig in town

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are Great but.....”
Reviews.Author: HongKong1234
Reviews.Content: Very noisy if your room is facing the street. Traffic seems to be Non-stop even after 1am in the morning. As you know, Barcelona never sleep.....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: 5starts
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! So modern, the room was great everything you needed and very stylish! The bed was really comforty. The spa was great we used it every day! I'd recommend doing the thermal circuit which was very relaxing and free! Also it always seemed quiet in there. There was one certain English man at the front desk who was lovely and very helpful! He remmended some great restaurants! Overall I would defiately recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “top hotel in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: bernbe
Reviews.Content: very good location for business and shopping. staff very helpful wonderful pool on top of the building lots of space in the rooms, separate wc and bathroom, nice decoration, modern but without overdoing lounge is a great place for having a drink, one immediately forgets the hectic street and city breakfast is served in a open space (good) but without a lot of natural light (bad), lots of fresh fruit and juices and nice little sandwiches good business room at no cost had a room street side, which was quite noisy (even with doors to balcony closed) airco didn't work and room was too warm to sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: silke a
Reviews.Content: We loved every single aspect of this hotel. Great location, wonderful service, perfect rooms and the roof with bar and pool make you want to stay in the hotel and not leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: qschzt
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 11 nights in June 2011 (sorry for the delay) during and around Sónar festival. There is a nice bar on the top of the building, not to miss. I had a large room with creaking wooden floors (a comfy plus), the room was always kept in exemplary state, and it had a small interior facing terrace. The internet connection here was extremely bad the whole time and they could never fix it properly during my stay. They did try, but just couldn't hack it.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “OMM is FAB”
Reviews.Author: Tracy006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel OMM on an overnight short weekend trip to Barcelona that we packed full of eating, drinking, strolling......The rooms are lovely, very contemporary, beautiful bed linens, and we had a lovely nights sleep. This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel, I fell in love with the bathrobes....need to get one of these, they are lovely. We sat on the roof terrace, beside the pool and it was beautifully warm, very relaxing, with wonderful views over the rooftops to the Gaudi buildings nearby. We also had breakfast the next morning, which was beautifully presented, lots of lovely small delicate dishes, with plenty of choice, beautifully prepared. We have also had lunch here on a previous trip, which again was really lovely, great ingredients, all beautifully presented.

Reviews.Title: “Be spoiled at Omm!”
Reviews.Author: NashTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Omm for 5 nights during our trip to Barcelona and Mallorca. We could not have asked for a better place. We arrived on a very early flight, only hoping to store our luggage but not expecting to get into our room until the afternoon. To our delight, our room was ready at 10:30am! The rooms are of the minimalist décor, with a nice, but tiny little balcony. I know some people on TripAdvisor have mentioned the separate toilet and shower/sink. While a little odd, we actually thought this was convenient, as you could still use the restroom if someone was showering or getting ready. The staff was always extremely helpful with any questions we might have. On the day we left, I realized we never had to call the front desk for a single thing (extra towels, etc) because they had already provided us with everything we needed. To me, that’s a sign of a great hotel. Location was great, right in the middle of the Passieg de Gracia and steps away from a Metro station. We had initially looked at hotels near La Rambla, but after visiting that area, we were so thankful that we chose the location of Hotel Omm. We felt very safe walking to/from dinner after dark, no one hassled us to buy anything. Everyone at Hotel Omm was very friendly and helpful with great customer service. We had an amazing dinner one night at their highly regarded restaurant, Moo. The rooftop terrace and pool was a great place to unwind after a day of sightseeing. I must add, the nightly turn down service with the chocolates on our pillow (and basic room clean up with new towels, etc.) was such a nice surprise!

Reviews.Title: “STYLISH HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: OLGAGreece
Reviews.Content: The last 2 years i 've visited 3 times this hotel.I was attracted by the location because it is at the beautiful Passeig de Gracia,therefore it is very modern very ''hip" hotel.The room was modern and clean it was spacious,the breakfast was very good very modern in a way.The hotel is near casa Batlo and La Pedrera near the high stores near the famous Las Ramblas.I highly recomend Omm hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: HongKongMember
Reviews.Content: Ever since my last stay in Barcelona I had been promising myself a stay at Omm, and I'm delighted to say it delivered what I had hoped. A contemporary style hotel to a very high standard in terms of room size, quality and comfort with a level of friendly and efficient service to match. There is a roof terrace for taking in the last sun of the day in my case, with bar and small pool. In truth, the pool is really very small, but it's on a roof in the city and, as with the rest of the hotel, stylish. The main restaurant, Moo, is at the back of the lobby area and although my stay was a Friday night with a good bar crowd, noise was not a problem. In fact, my guests and I took a somewhat long dinner with much talking, so only finished at around 2am, yet there was not even a hint from the staff that this could be a problem. Very importantly, there was no hint of noise from the bar when in the room and the lifts are off to one side so security is tight and controlled for guests. The buffet breakfast was perhaps a little disappointing, but that comes down more to my personal taste, the overall selection looked to be OK, just not for me. Car was delivered from the parking on time to round off a great stay. One to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in amazing city”
Reviews.Author: lorilander
Reviews.Content: Hotel Omm is wonderful. My husband and our adult daughter stayed at the hotel for five nights in early August. Located in L'Eixample neighborhood it is the perfect location for exploring Barcelona. From the refreshing roof deck pool you can watch the changing light bouncing off of Gaudi's fantastical chimneys atop La Pedrera (Casa Mila) apartment building on the next block. The Metro Diagonal station is around the corner, taking you quickly to the Ramblas, Barri Gothic , Barcelonetta or Parc Guell among other places. Or walk through the beautiful neighborhood of L'Eixample. Kaisu and the other staff are warm and incredibly helpful. They made us restaurant reservations (and some recommendations), obtained online tickets to La Sagrada Familia for us (definitely do this to avoid the lines) and were always extremely friendly. There is a wonderfully delicious breakfast buffet - Flautas with serrano ham (small crispy sandwiches), local cheeses, paper thin slices of pineapple, flaky small croissants, and more. Cooked eggs are available as well. Our rooms were lovely - calming and relaxing at the end of a day exploring the city, very nice shower and bath, very comfortable beds. Total blackout shades if you want to use them. The Hotel Omm is intimate and restful with a quiet contemporary design that is a great foil for Gaudi's exuberance on the next block.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel in perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Michalstadler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel end of August 2011 with my girlfriend and it was a beautiful pick. great location next to main shopping street, walking distance to Sagrada Familia and in great living district. Taxis are cheap and hotel has great service and beautiful Terrace with pool. the only dowside is cost of drinks which are 15E each. book via booking.com. Really nice one

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: charliesangel02
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in a suite. The rate board in reception showed the cost as 1,200 euros per night. If we had paid anything like that we would have felt extremely ripped off! The room was very nice. Had a four poster bed and a fabulous bathroom. My partner especially liked the massive waterfall shower. On the down side, you couldn't open the windows. They had key locks and even though we were in a suite, we had no balcony. The hallways leading to the room have floors which light up when you get out of the lift - the hallways are black and dimly lit so this really makes an impact! When we checked in we were immediately told the restaurant and nightclub were closed for the whole of August. The nightclub was one of the reasons for choosing the hotel, so I feel that should have been mentioned on their website. Reception was modern and stylish, but lacked atmosphere and was somewhat clinical. The roof terrace was pretty cool, although it took a fair while for someone to show up and serve us. The pool is small and is only waist deep, so it's only really there for you to cool off. Breakfast is served until 11:30am so we managed to eat enough incredibly delicious food to see us through until dinner time! Unffortunately we had a bad breakfast experience on the second day, thanks to a waiter that kept bringing us the wrong things and totally forgot our cooked breakfasts, even though he was reminded twice. The location of the hotel is in an upmarket area surrounded by designer shops and a stone's throw from one of the Gaudi apartment blocks - Cala Mila. Casa Batllo is a ten minute walk, and Sagrada Familia was about a 20 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and design but with some warnings”
Reviews.Author: Andreadica
Reviews.Content: We have been at Omm for one night in August. The hotel is located just off of one of the most fashionable street of the city. The room was nice, super trendy and very spacious, we liked it. The bar and restaurant of the hotel are pretty crowded and fancy. We had some helpful suggestions from the congierge even if he was a bit "rude".. The hotel has a parking which costs 30eur per night, (we knew this only from the bill at check out). In synthesis: it's a cool place and the rate per night is ok if you don't use any of the pricey options that the hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but not 5-star”
Reviews.Author: DubTraveller_10
Reviews.Content: I can't really fault this hotel much, but having stayed in other 5-star hotels in other countries I think Hotel Omm lacks something that could make it really special. The rooms are compact, yet stylish. Not everyone will like the fact that the shower room is separated from the main sleeping area by a partition wall only. The rooftop pool area is nice and relaxing but the pool itself is a bit on the small side. The desk staff were friendly and helpful (they booked a trip online to the Sagrada Familia for us, which was much appreciated after we saw the queues for the ticket booth when we got there!) but the bar staff were coldly efficient. The location is very good for those wanting to check out the sights, as it is a good stroll away from the mayhem of Placa Catalunya/Ramblas but just off a lovely boulevard (Paseig de Gracia) and close to two Gaudi houses. I've paid similar prices in the US and Ireland for accommodation that was far superior and genuinely 5-star.

Reviews.Title: “A very funky comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Genneau
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed here for 4 nights. It was a lovely hotel - the staff were really attentive making restaurant bookings for us and giving us useful recommendations (such as buying tickets for the Sagrada Familia online before visiting to avoid the queues!) as well as printing off maps and generally being very friendly. Our room was comfortable - black out blinds, excellent air con, comfy beds with soft sheets. The only reason I haven't rated this hotel as 'excellent' is because it didn't quite meet the 5* standard in some ways - such as the shower (which went from hot to cold quite randomly), the check-in process (we had to wait for over an hour for our room to be ready despite arriving just after 3pm) and the spa opening hours (stated at 9am to 9pm but actually it only opened at 1pm which was a shame given that we had to leave at 11am on our last day). These weren't big issues, and were compensated for by the fact that this was more of an intimate and interesting hotel to stay in than many other 5* hotels such as the Mandarin Oriental. But that said, we felt there were a few teething issues which the hotel had yet to overcome and which perhaps were a result of this being an 'add-on' to the Tragaluz restaurant chain rather than belonging to an international hotel group. Generally though we thought it was a great choice of hotel for a couple looking to have a weekend away complete with spa, rooftop pool (small but enough for cooling down) and a stunning view of La Pedrera. Top tip - if you want to use the spa facilities (a lovely big whirlpool with water massage beds, turkish bath, and hot and cold shower walkway, go on your first day as you are asked to pay 10 euros for the first use but it's free every time thereafter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: fredpan
Reviews.Content: Located along the Passeig de Gracia, it was within walking distance to La Rambla and to the Casa Mila. The service at the hotel was great, very friendly and always keen to help. The rooftop pool looked fantastic though I never had time to try it out. Only problem for me was the separated bath and toilet area in my room, couldn't understand the logic behind that

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful design hotel in nice area”
Reviews.Author: Pat-and-Jan
Reviews.Content: If you like beautiful design and a nice and safe area, and can get a good deal, then this is a great place to stay. The beds are FANTASTIC (and I'm not easy as regards quality of beds), the room is beautiful. However we found the breakfast too expensive for what you get (for only $4 extra you get a much more impressive breakfast at the W Hotel in a gorgeous location with a terrace). Staff is super friendly, speaks good English, and is very helpful. One minor detail in the room: very little or virtually no hooks to hang your bathrobe or clothes outside the closet. The terrace plus pool and pool bar is perhaps the greatest asset of this hotel, we went to rest there at the end of the day and that was a real treat - clean, calm, lounge atmosphere, great sunbeds! Anyway, great place if you can / want to afford it! Which doesn't mean that there couldn't be better deals in town if you don't mind for a sun deck and pool...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay - lovely hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: gocatio
Reviews.Content: Lovely....The building very distinguishable inside and out - bit of an arty vibe happening, the staff were friendly and spoke good english. The room was 'big' with a wall of windows along and a lovely view at the front of the hotel - has amazing silent electric shutters for blackout (why doesnt the uk have these everywhere?). Roof terrace is great for a drink, but the area is known for being windy - cute pool....very nice place for a drink and gaze over the rooftops . . and the the chimneys of the Gaudi apartment/Museum in the next block!!! So the location for museum visiting is Ideal. Hotel is a little tiny bit far up from the the hubbub and more in the equivalent area of Bond street, but it is all walkable - if you like a stroll - allow 15 mins from the top end of the ramblas area. We had one of our nicest meals of the trip in the restaurant Moo on the ground floor. The bar area is also pleasant / laid back and the general decor or the hotel is modern but relaxed. Good mix of different age groups staying at hotel. There is also an OK gym with basics and a business area with internet. The only annoyance was the TV - is such a lovely idea - a projection onto a big white wall but no amazing stuff to watch - we either watched 24 BBC News or gave up. . . if it had a DVD it would be great. Bar comes alive at night but didn't get disturbed by any noise (except cleaner next door too early). I would definitely want to go back - its a lovely hotel/stay that I would recommend and if you go - have a meal in Moo

Reviews.Title: “Always fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Barbara888Queenstown
Reviews.Content: Im still here and just want to say the hotel is everything I remember if not more in service and just the "bees Knees" of places to be. Hotel Omm, you rock. I love being back.

Reviews.Title: “I'm loving it”
Reviews.Author: Muriel0811
Reviews.Content: just come back from Barcelona for a long week end and I recomand Omm if you are looking for a calm and weel being. Though the hotel looks like one of those thousands minimalist sltyle hotel, it is well located, with great pool reserved to residents. Special thanks to Roberto, the best hairdresser of Barcelona !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would love to come back”
Reviews.Author: 32655Mark
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Omm when the rates on another hotel seemed too high. As a result, we stayed two nights at your hotel and then a week later stayed at the other hotel. We really didn't like the other hotel and kept wishing we were back at the Omm. The rooms and design were great, the staff was excellent. We would definitely come back and will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: iheartworldtravel11
Reviews.Content: The staff here were incredibly nice and helpful. I also loved the modern design - very cool shower and hallways. Perfect central location and a few blocks from the Casa Battlo and also the Pedrera (Gaudi architecture). You can also pick up the tourist hop on hop off bus a block from the hotel - arguably the most popoular way to travel in Barcelona. Very safe neighbourhood in the Eixample. Close to a bunch of restaurants. I hear the most popular club for tourists in Barcelona is in the basement of Omm, though I didn't visit it (I'm not a club type) so I can't comment. Decent restaurant with good service in the hotel. I would recommend this hotel. (Oh, fitness centre minimal with a bike, a treadmill, and pretty light dumbells, if that's your main interest it might not be ideal, but that was the only drawback I could think of.) I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: AniaKrasivskaya
Reviews.Content: Great value for money - perfect location, friendly staff, a lovely roof terrace with a bar and small swimming pool. Hope to be back-)

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: KennedysGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Hotel Omm is a great modern hotel the rooms are really special from the Tv projected on the wall to the double bathrooms mind you we did had a suite everything about this hotel is beautiful , the quaint pool upstairs over looking Barcelona , the bar down stairs is the best people watcher , this is a very trendy bar and our favorite place to hang at the end of the night where we would indulge in a different dessert every night all in all this is a very good hotel in a wonderful location .

Reviews.Title: “A bit overly designed, showing a little wear, eager but inexperienced staff”
Reviews.Author: fdf123
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a city of exciting architecture so we didn't want to stay in a boring, cookie cutter hotel. Unfortunately, exciting new design doesn't stay that way for long most of the time and these rooms already show a little datedness and a little fray. Maybe it's just us, but some of these type of newer places also offer far less bathroom privacy than the average adult couple wants (every sound from the bathroom seemed magnified through the room--there's a sliding door that doesn't really separate the BR from the main room very well, and no door on shower room either. Staff at the front desk seemed very young an inexperienced. I'd usually get a different answer to questions from each staff member, although they're all very friendly and try to be helpful. Although it is a 5-star hotel, there is no concierge and they were completely unable to assist us in getting theater tickets to a performance listed as sold-out on the website (I knew that was a longshot, but I figured at a 5-star they could at least make an effort). Wifi, although free, was LOUSY. Service would fade in and out, never more than 1-bar in the room. When I complained soon after check-in, to ask about moving us, I was told it is the same service throughout. They sent a "technician" to the room to assist--this was a man who's only equipment was his own cell-phone, and he announced he could get on the internet and left (I was trying with both iPhone and iPad). On check out the front desk acknowledged that many guests had complained about the wifi. Location was great, easy walk to lots of food, clubs, and shopping; metro less than 1 block away. The rooftop pool is fantastic--small, but enough to cool off and there are many deck chairs and a bar. I tried a massage in the spa but it was closer to 45' than the hour I booked, and the therapist completely ignored my repeated requests to pay special attention to my very sore quads, giving me the std, vanilla full-body massage instead--nothing special. We didn't eat anything there except the nightly chocolates on our pillow. The highly rated restaurant, Moo, had a menu that just didn't look all that exciting or different from what we could get stateside, but at a high price. Numerous other options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Hotel Omm!!!!! The nicest hotel I've been in.”
Reviews.Author: christinemds
Reviews.Content: I was on a trip to Spain and France with my family last month. We spent two nights at the Omm and had an amazing experience. It was the best part of our whole trip. I have traveled all over the world and stayed at more hotels (in my 43 years) than I care to count and this was by far the nicest hotel I've ever been in. The staff was extremely professional, helpful, and courteous. I felt like royalty there. The breakfast was amazing, the rooms were immaculate, and very comfortable. I loved the contemporary design of the hotel. The spa was gorgeous too. I will defnitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and well located”
Reviews.Author: Tanny81
Reviews.Content: Beautifully designed hotel and very well located right in the corner of the pleasant Passeig de Gracia avenue. The room was very comfortable and clean and had wi-fi. The pool had a cool view of the La Pedrera statues. The Michelin-stared Moo restaurant is worth a visit if you are an adventurous eater. The downsides were the few menu choices of room service and TV channels, and in the check-out if we didn't pay attention we'd have paid for a breakfast that we didn't have.

Reviews.Title: “Namaste. A very relaxing and rejuventating experience.”
Reviews.Author: linesandcurves
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel I have stayed. Unfortunately it was September 2009, but it still leaves me feeling good. The staff were so kind and helpful. The spa was relaxing and exactly what I wanted on the last day of my long holiday. It left me wanting to stay longer. The Moo restaurant was amazing with a fantastic Pre-Fixe meal and wine pairing. It's certainly not a hotel for those on a budget, but for those that can afford it, or those that want to really pay for a memorable experience, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Service sucks, rooms tiny, pool on roof is a soaking tub..just don't bother”
Reviews.Author: champagnetraveler
Reviews.Content: There are other better choices if you want to stay in this neighborhood. The concierge and staff push their owner's restaurants (she owns 18) on you versus telling you the places you should go. The 1 Michelin star restaurant is ok-la, not worth all that... the lounge in the lobby so dirty, cigarette ashes, stains, just gross. Room service doesn't know their menu, you have to explain to them what is on it, forget a concierge service. Doesn't exist. Room top lounge (billed as a awesome) is some big plastic chairs, with soaking tub (not pool by any means). Night Club downstairs for every single tourist in town. Just say no and keep going. ps - toilet is in a separate divide from bathroom, but has a sliding door and NO sink... Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Hotel Omm and the staff was great...”
Reviews.Author: Chanda0619
Reviews.Content: My group arrived at Hotel Omm for a ten day stay. The hotel proactively work to coordinate our arrival, stay and departures (there were two trips to Madrid and the Canary Islands). The hotel rooms were spacious and included music for resting (Calm) and for getting ready for a night out (Climax). Also, the hotel tried to accommodate us by having at least two groups together on each floor. I will say that Barcelona is a great city and the staff were so passionate about their city and their country when we asked questions. This was definitely a great boutique hotel. It is central to all the high-end shopping, city attractions and eateries. Just a side note: Restaurant Moo has great service and food. While we Americans tend to like larger portions, the food presentation and size were pleasing and filling.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place, great bar, great service, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: David_Kirkland
Reviews.Content: The Omm is similar to W Hotels - small rooms without much closet space. Service was very good, location is ideal, and the rooftop pool is a great addition. One caveat: the pool gets shady in the afternoon, and the pool itself is quite small. But it's nice to have a break and enjoy the sun outdoors. Our room was very nice, but the floor is this pergo stuff and it squeaks terribly. If one partner is sleeping, you can't get out of bed without waking him or her up! I enjoyed the hotel, but probably would stay elsewhere next time - in a larger room, for one thing.

Reviews.Title: “Modern twist in beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: RJT52
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights here as part of short city break. If you like modern clean lines you will not be disappointed here. Rooms were very clean and spacious. Hotel is well positioned just off main thoroughfare and within walking distance of Sagrada Familia. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was tasty but we felt overpriced. We would have no hesitation in returning and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern design hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: venatoris
Reviews.Content: Great modern design, and our room was very large. All the in-room facilities you would expect. The hotel has an enormous comfortable bar, but we didn't try the restaurant on this occasion. Metro station is just round the corner, and many attractions are walkable, La Pedrera is on the next block so you can arrive at opening time and beat the queues, and get pictures of the roof with NO people! Lots of upscale shopping nearby, many many choices of places to eat as well. We has such a fantastic stay, I would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... (But Too Cool For Me?)”
Reviews.Author: nycstella
Reviews.Content: There are many things to like about this hotel - great location, funky decor, good restaurants, friendly and helpful staff. I didn't really have any complaints about my stay - only the observation that for the first time in my life, I felt like I was staying at a hotel that was too cool for me. The vexing lighting in the rooms was "inventive" to say the least, and it took me 2 days to figure it all out. Among the many pros - our room had a private terrace, which didn't have a particularly spectacular view of anything (random apartments across a courtyard), but it was nice to have a place to sit outside and sip wine, and it was quiet. Dinner at the hotel restaurant was divine. Usually a bit wary of eating at a hotel restaurant because it always seems like they are catering to people too lazy to venture out, and therefore don't have to aim too high. However, I had 4 courses with the recommended wine pairings, and it was nothing short of amazing. We were in Barcelona for 4 days and this was the best meal I had. (It also seemed to be a "destination" and there was not a free table.) The roof has a long skinny pool and places to sun yourself. Extremely pleasant place to spend the afternoon, with the added bonus that you are looking directly onto the roof of Gaudi's La Pedrera with it's other-worldly roof sculptures.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet our expectations”
Reviews.Author: npatel81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I saved this hotel for the last leg of our trip in Barcelona. This was our "splurge," costing us about $300 a night. I´m a teacher and he´s a resident, so 300 bucks a night is a lot for us. Nonetheless, we saw the website, noted that it was in an excellent location, and it was rated 5 stars. WELL.....we arrived around noon to check into the hotel, but our room wasn´t ready. I assumed that since it was a 5 star hotel, tehy would have their housekeeping staff clean our room within the hour, but no...our room was not ready until 3pm (their original check-in time, despite being told it may be ready earlier). So we checked into our hotel room and there was sooooo much noise coming from the hallway. The doors are paper thin and we were hearing all the noise from the hotel staff cleaning the conference room on our floor (for some reason the conference rooms are on the top floor). We kept calling the front desk and they kept assuring us they would advise them to stop making the noise, but it didn´t. THEN they said they would transfer us to a room, but they moved us onto the first floor NEXT door to the spa (lots of traffic), and worse yet...above the disco!!! (yup, theres a disco in the hotel). So then we had to move all the way back up to our original room because the only other room they had was a "superior room" and they didnt want to give us the free upgrade. Anyway, you would think that they may give us a complimentary bottle of wine or something since we went through all this, but no...they gave us a bottle of mineral water!!! In terms of cleanliness, there were cruds of food or something left by the previous guest that went unnoticed by the cleaning staff, even after waiting three hours for the room. Despite all these negative remarks, I do have to say that the hotel is located in a great area, it has a really nice lobby and hotel bar, and the people working at the front desk are actually really nice and friendly. Two of them in particular were verrrrry helpful and genuinly felt bad for us. I´m just surprised that all this mayhem was not a concern for the manager and you would think they would want to comp us with something...I´ve had better service at a 3 star hotel! We stayed at Hotel Sixtytwo during the first leg of trip and this was a MUCH better hotel. Our room was clean, the service was great, and they gave us a free bottle of champagne in our room.

Reviews.Title: “WOW Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travvelalot
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure, we had a great experience. We stayed april 8-11 and had a wonderful experience Front desk staff was friendly and knowledgeable. They were very accommodating and spoke English as needed when interacting with them. Our room was amazing, we were upgraded to a suite which had lots of space and a great view of the courtyard. We used the spa for massage and it was great. I recommend the Thai Massage. Dinner in casual restaurant was great and hotel has a lively bar scene late night. The only negative I experienced was the female bar staff on April 10 during the day. They could care less about guests in the bar. The location is great with lots to do nearby i highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: aWayfarer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Omm was a perfect spot during my recent work trip to BCN, and certainly would be an excellent chose for a Holiday trip as well. The Hotel was modern and fresh with clean, comfortable and spacious rooms. The continental breakfast in the bar was easy and delicious with a variety of items - cured meats, cheeses, paninis, fresh fruit, yogurt & granola, homemade pastries, etc... The bar is very popular in the evenings amongst locals, tourists and hotel guests. Location is great - close to many sites, shopping and restaurants. Doorman and concierge helpful with recommendations, taxis, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a couple”
Reviews.Author: fabiopaiz
Reviews.Content: Very good restaurant (Michelin star) and lounge. Comfortable rooms. Perfect for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “great restaurant and lounge / overmarketed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slonik220v
Reviews.Content: great restaurant with cozy lounge bar at the lobby mixed with locals and fashionable hotel guests / trendsetting atmosphere and service and indeed innovative cuisine as for hotel - comfort and functionality definitely gave way to the style and design / not big in general, rooms are designed in such a way that it's not very easy to unpack laggage / lighting system is too complicated / finally, you're constantly interrupted by the noise from the corridor and street

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Indeed - Location, Room & Quality Great”
Reviews.Author: cocacolacub
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights (over Valentine's weekend) in a standard room. Positives Very trendy hotel in good location for all the Gaudi sites (we walked to Parc Guell as it was such a nice day!) Rooms very clean, trendy & practical with the most amazing blackout blinds... slept until after lunch on one day as they were so effective Good bar & restaurant vibe (although we ate at Moo and were underwhelmed with the food.. Con Gracias which is within walking distance was so much better) Spa very good - had a thai massage which rivals anything I have had in Thailand (although much more expensive) Responsive reception who were helpful for directions, etc No real negatives - was quite expensive but a v good choice. Any questions then happy to be contacted

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sofia189473
Reviews.Content: cool hotel in a convenient area. Nice mohitos, good service, spacious rooms, no noise

Reviews.Title: “A truly excellent hotel in the Centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Vikingolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days with four adult children sharing three different quality rooms, and were delighted. In particular, the location is excellent, and the service is truly first class - we felt like we had our own personal Concierge for the full time we were there. Can we mention also the first class restaurant. Would have loved a heated pool, but the Spa rated very well with us also, including the plunge pool. Thanks also for organising hair cuts for the entire family at short notice - and very good too!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience....”
Reviews.Author: elenanyc9
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at Hotel Omm. The hotel vibe is very cool and chic as well as their guests! The hotel lobby bar was quite active with beautiful Catalans as well as visitors. The service at the restaurant was satisfactory but the doormen and front desk were exceptional! I read about the hotel room lights on one of the comments written by a previous guest. Yes, agree that the lighting in the room is a bit troubling deciding which button to select but it actually was quite humorous for us. It's all about the attitude and expectations. I

Reviews.Title: “Omm offers taste, service and excellent value in a terrific area of Barcelona..”
Reviews.Author: TwoLoons9
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. The hotel staff were warm and extremely helpful. The neighborhood is a high end tourist area w great cafes, restaurants and shops. Also right next to metro that connects to other areas. Could not have asked for a better hotel especially after surviving travel through NY snowstorm! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A place to be if you fly to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Epopee
Reviews.Content: Our 4th consecutive New Eve stay at OMM. No need to say that we become familiar. - Not only comfortable the suites overlooking on the interior courtyard are really silent. - The so atypical "Lobby Bar Restroom" makes Omm such a different place. - Breakfast remains a nice moment in the quiet of the morning. - Moo Restaurant is an interesting spanish cooking experience. - And last but not least location - 50 meters to Metro - brings you instantly to any place in Barcelona One only suggestion : Wi-Fi should be heavily boosted. No doubt, no question we love OMM and will come back soon !

Reviews.Title: “everything you need in a hotel and a great location”
Reviews.Author: trip_reviews_by_mr_c
Reviews.Content: very pleasant 4 days stay in dec 2010 at omm. great location, confortable room, efficient service, bar and club with atmosphere, great food even if you do not go to the moo restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Management and service with terrible attitude and poor timescales”
Reviews.Author: PDounias
Reviews.Content: I visited Barcelona last July and based on the ratings on this site I decided to stay there. The rating needs to lower significantly to reflect the actual quality of the hotel and the people running the hotel so no more visitors will be missled, like I did. After a 10 hours flight, I arrived at the hotel at 1pm and my room was not ready. The staff told us that it would be ready in an hour but after hanging around for an hour, we found out that this wan not the case. So no shower and no toilet for me after a 10 hours flight on a hot summer day in Barcelona for a hotel I have payed more than 200 euros per night. We went for lunch and got back at 5.30 pm. The staff told us that the room was now ready but our suitcases was not in the room, a sign for me that the room was just made up. On that evening, I went to the roof garden. There was a corporate event going on for AmEx and as soon as I set foot in on the roof, the hotel event manager appeared in front of me saying that the bar is closed, the space is occupied and but I can enjoy the view for a while. I think she got horrified by my pair of jeans and flip-flops but that is her problem. I sat there for 20 min and I lit a cigarette. And guess who I saw in front of me - the event manager once again telling me I should be careful not to drop the ashes out of the balcony. I was really shocked by her patronising behaviour. I was ready to start a seriour argument with her. I didn't though, as I respected her guests even though she clearly does not respect hers. In check out, we were 20 min late and the phone rang 4 times saying that we had to vacate the room. By then I was so mad I told them that my room was ready on check in at 5 pm ( they denied that fact which is a big fat lie), and that I give them 2 hours to prepere the room and that I will move out accordingly. I'm sorry I get into all that detail. What I try to say is that my Barcelona trip was not what I was expecting and the sole reason is the very unpleasant experience I had in this hotel, having paid top dosh for it. Other than that, rooms were ok (just ok), location central but very busy and noisy and drinks sky high prices and weak. Overall, an overpriced 3star hotel, on a bubly and loud facade. Not too hard to scratch behing the surface and see what you;re dealing with.

Reviews.Title: “Whaever else you do, you must eat at the Moo Restaurant in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: brian_horwell
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night and in fact only got to use the room for 3 hours so it is hard to judge that side of the hotel. However, the staff were excellent. I arrived very late and they could not have been more helpful. I had a table booked in the Moo Restaurant and it was one of the best meals I have ever had and was excellent vaue. I gave the sommelier the regions I wanted the wines from but let him choose the specific wine. He could have gove very expensive like most Michelin star restaurants would but he did not and they were excellent choices. Youy must also have the Trip to Havana desert, it is incredible (and I do not eat deserts!). I would also highly recommned the breakfast which comes from the Moo kitchens. The home made criossants are the best I have ever had! Well done, a pleasure to have stayed and eaten there and I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “If you care about your belongings, don't go here, they will steal them”
Reviews.Author: CesarAlonso
Reviews.Content: This an example of what a 5* hotel, should not be, even the manager assume they have a security problem. We were there last week and somebody from the staff stole a professional photo camera, then the hotel say than they don't have enough surveillance CCTV to cover the hall and the street and they completely denied to take any responsibility. I'm a frequent traveller, and never saw that level of unprofessionally. Totally, NOT RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pooks2Go
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It's in a nice part of town (chic stores, food, etc) and not in the tourist mess by the ramblas. It's also by the subway so you can get everywhere easily. My big complaint is that the service is lacking. Nowadays, especially at these trendy boutique hotels, you have nice design but the place is run by unprofessional, apathetic kids. They weren't rude but they weren't exactly professional or hospitable. There is a certain level of service I expect from a 5 star hotel that I didn't get here. Our room was delayed and the girl could only say sorry (no offer of anything or suggestions). For dinner reservations, they couldn't get tables at a couple of restaurants and made no other suggestions - again, the blank stare and "sorry". When I stay at a "top" hotel, I expect that they have connections to get me into places I wouldn't be able to do on my own. If it becomes more work for me, then the value of paying for a tops hotel is lost. I might as well stay at a cheaper hotel if I am in charge of getting everything together. The other issue I had was more unique. Before I continue, I should let you know that when our room was finally ready, it was a bit run down: paint needs to be done, the closet was broken (and not fixed) so I couldn't get my clothes, the furniture was a bit banged up. They had a CD player on the wall which seemed a bit dated and could have used a Ipod dock or something. Also, I hate it when the hotel offered communal tubs of soap, shampoo, and cream! It just seems cheap (and unhygenic) when they don't offer individual sample sizes of the stuff and it is not very luxurious. Also weird layout where the toilet was in a separate room around the corner from the bathroom. So, when we came back from dinner on our first night at like 1 am, we get to our room and the door doesn't work. We go back down they insist the key is broken but we know that it's an electrical problem since the light was off on the key slot. We go back and forth and finally they come up and it turns out that, in just our room, the power has died. I don't know why the power died but we end up having to pack all our stuff (at this point it's about 1:45 am) in THE DARK with the BROKEN CLOSET and move into a huge suite on another floor. The suite was great - huge, 2 rooms, etc. but I would have preferred a free night or dinner. I'm on vacation so I'm not spending a lot of time in the room so the added space was a deal breaker for me. They sent us champagne (which we don't drink) and that's it. Again, they made a 4 star effort when they are suppose to be a 5 star hotel. I did like the bed-very big and comfortable. Also, the room was very quiet so can't complain about that. Overall, it was ok. It was a bit of scene happening every night in the lobby and very hipster/media types there. Not really for me but some people might like that stuff. There is a Michellin star restaurant which was good but we preferred the Terraza del Casino in Madrid for science-food. Free wifi is available which is great!

Reviews.Title: “Truly enjoyed our stay with one exception”
Reviews.Author: Beliza1947
Reviews.Content: This was a Mother/Daughter vacation. For my 23 year old daughter this was a great hotel selection in a central, busy part of town. We stayed 7 nights. She and I both enjoyed the street-side lounge with beautiful people and a great DJ, different each night. The location was amazing, allowing us to easily site-see and shop on foot, by taxi, or bus to all parts of the city. The modern design and large room for a boutique hotel, including a balcony overlooking the organic garden was comfortable and inviting. (We could have lived without the ugly wash hanging from the balconies of the apartments across the way.) The mood-setting light system once you figure out how it works is fun and quite adequate. The room had a table and chairs and a modified desk, which was nice. The bed was a bit too hard, but the sheets were starched and perfectly clean and crisp. We loved the robes. The bathroom lighting though is really dark for applying make-up. The make-up mirror, which didn't tilt was poor. The TV stations offered provided the news but not many choices. That could be upgraded, offering more stations and movies. We loved the curtains allowing us via bedside push button total darkness or half light. I liked the privacy of having the toilet and bidet separate from the shower and vanity. The concierge and front desk staff were unbelievably nice and attended to our every need. One door man ran down the street and stayed with us over ten minutes one evening to fetch a difficult-to-get taxi. The food in both the formal, Michelin-starred Moo and casual restaurant beside the bar is absolutely delicious...beautifully presented!! (way better than The Arts Hotel) My big complaint is the pretty bar and waitress staff at the lounge restaurant. They were impossibly, deliberately rude. A shocking contrast to the friendly and helpful front desk staff. My daughter thought the dark halls were "cool". I could have lived without that. But have seen this done at other chic boutique hotels. As I said, this is a perfect hotel when traveling with 18-35 year olds. My daughter went to the night club and liked it. She had a massage, but felt it was merely average. The business office was sufficient for my needs. They never did get our WiFi in the room fixed, but we survived. Since we played golf twice, and walked for miles, we didn't need the gym. Can't comment on that. At all times I felt safe and secure in my room. All in all, when I return to Barcelona with older "kids", this will be my choice again. It was very fun. Hotel Omm fulfilled its purpose (with the above mentioned few exceptions) perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: binkie67
Reviews.Content: The OMM staff were friendly, helpful and professional. Our rooms were spotless with the most comfortable beds and pillows.We enjoyed the loby area for drinks and more casual dining. The MOO restaurant was exceptional and imaginative. The hotel is in a great location to explore this fabulously stylish city. It is close to good shops and within walking distance of plenty restaurants, if one did not want to eat in the hotel's excellent restaurants. There is plenty of interesting architecture close by. The metro is easy to use, for further distances.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, conveniently loctaed and great service”
Reviews.Author: dob14
Reviews.Content: Modern feel, refreshing contrast to the more classic and traditional hotels. Good location, has a great restaurant, free internet (which should always come free with establishments of this category), and helpful concierge (very helpful on email prior to arrival). Would prefer in-room international movies to bring the hotel up to international standards. We had superior room- spacious with nice touches. Love the electric black out shutters. There was incident at the Spa which was immediately and professionally dealt with by the Director General.

Reviews.Title: “nice try”
Reviews.Author: Marius20101025
Reviews.Content: the house needs some repairs. tv´s are old, bad picture, green faces on right side maybe magnetic field from fridge. tub is very slippery, dangerous. windows do not protect from noise of street at all ! (woke up 06.00 am every day, not relaxing) but people are nice and breakfast is very good. in summary, sorry. not worth the 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Omm...Hmmmm....”
Reviews.Author: wanakabelg
Reviews.Content: Hmmm...not bad but certainly not the "5star design" it claims to be...Omm has a lot going for it ( superb location, nice set-up) yet unfortunately not making the most of it. The "too cool for school"-personnel maybe does need to go to service school after all. If you're claiming 5* hotel, then artistically posing in nice outfits is not enough to give your clientele value for money. And we love design, yet this doesn't mean that isolation has to suffer: we could literally hear everything and everyone in the hallway and surrounding rooms, and when the toilet in the room above was flushed it felt like someone taking a shower next to your bed. So we woke up 5 times in one night due to this. "Omm" really wasn't as zen as expected...

Reviews.Title: “Cutting edge - but totally impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Lochlady
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just spent a few days in Barcelona - an autumn city break which we enjoyed very much. We know Barcelona well, and have stayed at a number of the city's hotels in the past. We decided to try the Hotel Omm because it has had good reviews and is fairly central. Fortunately, we were out most of the time, and only returned to the hotel to sleep, because we found it impersonal and lacking in any kind of charm. The reception staff were pleasant, but rather remote, and as the lifts were very near the street door we felt that we might as well have been staying in an apartment, for all the human contact we had with anyone in the hotel. At no time did we see anyone - staff or guests - in the hotel corridors. The corridors were most peculiar: they were lined with what appeared to be black rubber, and the (very dim) lighting was provided by what appeared to be striplights under the floor, so that the effect was of a long black runway. Even at 9 in the morning, it felt like midnight. Our room was (of course) at the back of the hotel, and overlooked what was described as the "patio" - really a backyard, surrounded by flats with washing hanging out on the balconies and with people coming and going all the time, so that we felt obliged to keep the semi-transparent screen closed whenever we were in the room. The beds were very comfortable indeed - credit where it is due! - but we found a bad stain on one of the sheets and had to ask to have it changed. We also discovered a cockroach in the bathroom, which we mentioned in a note we left for the maid. It disappeared, but I don't know if that was because she caught it, or because it simply escaped. Rather annoyingly, our bathrobes were removed on the second day, and were not returned until the evening of the third day, although we rang reception to ask for them as soon as we realised they were missing. The bathroom arrangements were odd - the bath, shower and washbasin were in one room (part of the bedroom, really) and the lavatory and bidet were in another, at the other side of the room. Something that we found really irritating was the fact that the lighting system was quite complicated, and it was difficult to work out which button controlled which light. The light in the bathroom was feeble, to say the least - all very atmospheric, but useless when applying makeup We are used to high minibar prices in city hotels, but at the Omm the prices were outrageous - 9 to 10 euros for spirits and 5 euros for mixers - so that a gin and tonic would have cost 14 euros 50. Needless to say, we waited and went out to a bar off the main drag, where drinks were considerably cheaper. All in all, we felt that the hotel was not good value for money, and the ambiance was urban chic taken to the extreme.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel but not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: SEVA01
Reviews.Content: Hotel Omm is a design hotel with most probably used to be a 5 star hotel. To my opinion they forgot in last years that beside design rooms, they also have to offer 5 start service to be entitled to put a plate in front with 5 stars. The rooms (stayed in Superior room) were OK, clean and design, but you could already see that it is build some 7 years ago. The shower was not 100% fixed, the wooden plates in the bathroom were not so clean anymore, ... In these time, you should also expect a big flatscreen in a design room instead of a small old fashion TV (working well, but not OK for a room of 375 €/day WITHOUT breakfast). Talking about the breakfast : it was OK but very poor. Moreover it was served in the lobby, the food on the counter of the bar, were the day before we were drinking with a lot of people. There is a restaurant, but for some bizar reason, they are not using it. Maybe it is to much work to redo the tables after the breakfast ..... No live cooking (for scrambled eggs or pancakes), only one sort of bread, no fish, no champagne, no fresh juices, ... all this for 25 € per person. Something about the swimming pool : it is to small to swim. There is also steamcabine, but you have to wear swimming trousers because the cool off douches are in front of windows without any covering ..... strange. At night, the hotel is a hotspot for all people of Barcelona. This is a good thing, because you can enjoy the atmosphere and go to the club afterwards. Minus : we ordered a coffee and could not get at 23.00u (was not served anymore). We ordered a Mojito and .... after 15 minutes and 3 times asking ... it still had not arrived. So we decided to go to the club without drinks ... Anyway, to conclude, this hotel was a 5 star hotel but it is now maximum a 4 star. I would suggest to the manager, which we have not seen in 3 days, that he visits the Mandarin Oriental. We went there for dinner and the service and atmosphere was top. The people knew what to do and when. There was always a manager to guide them. To my opinion, having a lot of experience in managing companies, this hotel needs very quickly a very good manager. The people working in the hotel are doing what they can, but due to missing of a guiding hand, it is not working as it should be. If the rate of the rooms would be 150 to 200 €, I would say, OK. But if you have to pay 375 € for a superior room without breakfast, then there are other alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooftop pool and bar!”
Reviews.Author: hd21uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omm on a last-minute trip to Barcelona and we generally very happy with the hotel. The modern style of the decor is very nice, but in places looks like it could do with being refreshed. We ate in the informal brasserie and also in the Michelin-starred Moo restaurant, both of which were very tasty, if a tad on the pricy side , and also were happy to cater for my vegetarian diet. We had no problems with the staff, in fact they weny out of their way to be helpful. My favourite area of the hotel is definitely the rooftop pool and bar. We enjoyed a swim followed by lunch, and also had pre-dinner cocktails while the sun went down - heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rather overpriced”
Reviews.Author: stuartwebb41
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel though the nightclub kept us up half the night. Breakfast was delicious but so expensive we opted for a local bakery on subsequent days. Room was spacious and comfortable and stylish. Good atmosphere at night and great to come back to the lively bar scene if you have the stamina.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was Rude and Pompous!”
Reviews.Author: grappler184
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to arrive on Tuesday and but instead called from our hotel in Valencia to try and book Monday night as well. We were told that all they had were junior suites and that it would be 230 E more than our regular rate. So we went online to see what we could do at other hotels and presto there are rooms available. We show up and they say that was a mistake and they put us in a junior suite. But we would have to change to the regular room the next day. It seemed shady like they were trying to rip us off. The staff was very short and acted like we had just walked into their house uninvited. We were not too happy about the situation. But went on our way. We went to the bar were we were served by the worst bar staff I have ever encountered in my life. Not only were they rude they acted like they didn't care if you wanted anything. So we had one drink and some tapas and left. We then revisited the bar later that evening and ran into another couple who ran into the same problems with the staff and their room. I thought maybe it was just cause we were American. But then later on another gentlemen from Denmark who said he stays at the OMM quite frequently ran into similar problems. And I quote "Can I hang out with you guys the people who work at this hotel make me hate the Spanish". I would not stay at this hotel. The staff is very discourteous and they are doing a lot of work on the hotel that wakes you up in the morning. For the amount of money that you pay to stay here there are tons of other options. Stay away from the OMM!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location but service could be better.”
Reviews.Author: cac67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Omm for 5 nights during the course of our two week vacation visiting Spain. Great location and the hotel was probably once incredible, but is now only good. It's been worn and may need a bit of TLC soon. Good amenities. Comfortable rooms. We had a room with a balcony that was on the 2nd floor. Heard the music from the club all night long!!! Gym is average at best. Restaurant had great selection of food. Overall, service staff was unnecessarily pretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: robert/els
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a design hotel with excellent service and great ambience. It is very lively and in the evening the lobby changes into a lounge bar full of people, with excellent service, drinks etc. You absolutely don't notice any sounds from downstairs in your rooms. I really enjoyed the ambiance. The rooms are excellent although the airco sometimes switched off, but that was a small thing in the total excperience. Breakfast was very good. The roof terrace was very relaxing, the pool is a bit on the small side though. Wireless network available in all the rooms and everywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Irishguest
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. It could not be in a better location; its right next to the Passeig de Gracia and within walking distance of most of the main Gaudi sites. We liked the style of the place -it is very modern but -unlike some other modern hotels - it is very comfortable and the colour palette is restful rather than garish. The food was excellent too - very well presented, delicious, and with high quality ingredients. But breakfast in the room is overpriced for what you get. There were a few quibbles; I found the lighting controls in the bedroom/open plan bathroom difficult to navigate, and I thought it was downright silly (and, frankly, unhygienic) to have the wc and the bathroom so far apart. We were upgraded to a very stylish suite, but there was long distance between the wc and the bathroom and nowhere to wash one's hands beside the wc. One has to walk out of the wc and right round the (very large and elegant) bed to get to the bathroom to wash! We could also hear the traffic very clearly so I would recommend earplugs. We found the staff to be almost universally friendly and helpful but there was one man in the bar who seemed to regard himself as too grand by far to attend to guests and that did spoil things a little. But not enough to erode the very favourable impression we had of all the other staff we dealt with. These small quibbles aside, we loved the hotel and would go back tomorrow. We had stayed in the Casa Fuster in August and really liked it too, but, on balance, I think I would prefer the Omm. The location is just a little better (not having to cross the Diagonal everyday helps) and the overall "feel" of the place is more to my liking. In addition, the food ( in terms of taste, quality and selection) is so much better. In short, it's a great addition to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Trop de chi chi / to much fuss”
Reviews.Author: GeorgesM49
Reviews.Content: Not real Internet connection Room was forgotten to be cleaned up( during 10AM and 4PM )

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely try to stay in this hotel again when in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: pristoja
Reviews.Content: Modern, contemporary interior with an exceptionally well designed lighting. Attentive, friendly and very professional service with close to 100% hit-rate. Some, only few, promises to do things not delivered, but the ones where people really took charge solving some issues were so good that they outnumbered the glitches. Excellent restaurants, both the Moovida (lobby) and the Michelin star MOO. Delicious breakfast. Bar's popularity with the locals is a plus. Well-designed roof-terrace with a pool, bar and a good view. One recommendation: if the customer contacts (e.g. via e-mail) the front-desk/concierge before the stay, it would be good to bring the messaging and questions up when customer is registering into the hotel. This would help to run a double-check and avoid any misunderstandings(like with restaurant reservations etc...). As a summary, we would give a strong recommendation to OMM!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: TheONeillsinOz
Reviews.Content: We had the most incredible time at Hotel OMM. The staff sent us to 3 of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at in my life, nothing was an issue, room size was extremely generous, the roof top pool and bar was discreet and relaxing. We were also lucky enough to view not 60 metres away the roof top of Casa Milla - one of Gaudi's finest buildings. We had massages which were exceptional and good value. Alex, Guillame and Lucien (front desk) dealt with our limited Catalan with grace and 5 star service. We will be back and this was definitely the highlight of 2Aussies in Europe. Congratulations Hotel OMM the recommendation will be made to all fellow Australian travellers with confidence

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice people, some irritations...”
Reviews.Author: dc65_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything the reviews said it would be, chic, cool, beautiful people. We requested a street facing room with balcony but got a courtyard facing room (which is not a pretty sight - see pic)...and no apology for having no record of our request (despite me presenting the email to the staff). It made quite a difference to our stay. In fairness the girl on reception did suggest we come back each day and ask if a street facing room is available - but that's time wasting you don't need on a weekend break. Okay, hotels are all over priced when it comes to drinks, breakfast etc....but 40.50 euro's for a half bottle of average champagne in the mini bar and 28 euro's for a basic breakfast is just an insult to a guests intelligence. If prices were double the 'real' price it would be acceptable, but 4x...you'd have to be a fool (or on company expenses) to pay it... Staff were very helpful and always friendly. The hotel is perfectly placed for the Metro (without doubt the easiest and quickest way around town - and soooo much cleaner and more pleasant than the London tube I have to suffer every day).

Reviews.Title: “Sleek sophisticated adult hotel”
Reviews.Author: a114411a
Reviews.Content: Sophisticated hotel in the best part of Barcelona. If you are looking for a chain style hotel, this is not for you. If you like the W brand you will be very happy here

Reviews.Title: “chic”
Reviews.Author: jaymum
Reviews.Content: Don't be discouraged by negative comments about this hotel I can say with all honesty I would choose to stay here again without hesitation. The staff are polite, helpful and very friendly. Wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: OneNightTraveller
Reviews.Content: Positive reviews are usually short - given that absent the ranting, you can say you are happy with the hotel in only a few words. OMM is not a cheap place, but it certainly exhibits that desire for excellence, that you would expect from a 5-star hotel. Its location is perfect, rooms are truly modern with very impressive bathrooms. I don't share the rants about light controls being confusing - at least during our stay they were clearly signposted. The staff were also very kind and responsive in a polite and unobtrussive sort of way. The bed was extremely comfortable, with the now customary turn down service. Air conditioning was excellent - very quiet and set to the perfect temperature for a good night's sleep. You should be aware that some ot the suites/rooms face the inner courtyard which is not necessarily an exciting view. However on balance sleeping on the inside is probably the better option, because these rooms are very very quiet, so I (a troubled sleeper) had the best sleep in a hotel, I have had for years. The only rant I have is about the TV set, which was installed in a way that did not allow it to be viewed from the bed without one of the bed posts being in the way. If they had allowed a longer cable it wouldn't really be an issue. This can easily be fixed so I am surpirsed they actually missed it. Perhaps a word of caution to the owners of the property is that it is apparent that some of the interior is starting to show signs of wear (e.g. slightly dirty sofa upholstry in the lobby, scraped wall panels in the dining area of the lobby, discolored wood flooring in the pool area etc.). They are minor yet, but if OMM itends to keep its guest satisfaction level they should monitor and fix those as soon as they appear.

Reviews.Title: “an experience”
Reviews.Author: ArmaghApple
Reviews.Content: great location near to restaurants and bars in an area that is probably better than las ramlas (which is worth seeing but too crowded). the roof top bar and pool is excellent place to relax in the heart of barcelona - and the views say it all. also beside the metro and therefore easy access to trains for trips outside the city especially monserat and st cugat. servive could not have better and the choice of music adds so much. this is my third or fourth visit and i will return.

Reviews.Title: “A special beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: israeliontheroad
Reviews.Content: Unique decor excellent roof pool amazing rooms good buzz happening in the lobby devine spa what can I say one of the best

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quinn5
Reviews.Content: Modern but tasteful. Our room was lovely with plenty of space. Staff were terrific in every part of the hotel. Unless you want to eat a huge amount, the breakfast is expensive (23€) and not worth it. For small (continental) breakfast eaters like us,there are many better options just a short walk from the hotel where you can eat for 5-6€. The michelin starred restaurant was closed for holidays during our stay. Very convenient location, 10 mins walk to Sagrada Familia, 20 mins to Gothic Quarter via La Rambla. Rooftop terrace with (very small) pool is a treasure especially in early evening after a day's sightseeing/shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Cool stylish hotel but is in need of a little TLC”
Reviews.Author: karenlpearce
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and staff very friendly. Design good but starting to look a little worn in places. We were there in August and the restaurant and nightclub were closed so the hotel was very quiet not the "happening" atmosphere described. The ground floor bar was comfortable and relaxing and it was great to have the rooftop pool although the chairs and loungers were very uncomfortable. The view from our balcony onto the "garden" was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Location and very nice Bar”
Reviews.Author: tinita999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the OMM in Barcelona with my boyfriend in the spring of this year. We had a very nice large room and the staff at the reception desk was very helpful with all our questions. The location of the hotel is perfect as beautiful and vivd Passeo de Gracia is only a few steps away. At night we had delicious drinks at the nice hotel bar. Overall it was a very nice stay and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “trendy and confortable”
Reviews.Author: sandrinesand
Reviews.Content: All was perfect, specially beds and breakfast. 2 bad points : Swimming pool is not really one and staff is quite cold and unpersonnal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FlyingDave
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and the staff very helpful. The location really makes this hotel, though.
