It is in the high end shopping district with walking distance to many restaurants, the metro and other things. It is away from the toursity hotels and La Rambla, but that does not make it bad for me. We walked to the tourist events during the day and got away from the nasty tourist restaurants in the evening. It is very trendy and modern which may not appeal to everyone. The staff helped us find restaurants and provided great information. The rooms are nice and the roof deck pool is fun. English is easily spoken here if necessary. High speed WIFI internet is all you can drink for as many devices as you have. I would highly recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Too modern and artsy for our liking”
Reviews.Author: Jetset227
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on several hotels in Barcelona, I finally settled on choosing Omm for my 3 day stay with my boyfriend. Photos, desciptions, reviewers enthusiasm all played a role in my choice. When I got to the hotel I realized it was not for me. First off, I adore modern hotels with modern decor; the lobby in this hotel is very modern - however you get to the front desk and deal with very "modern" staff - I'm using that in place of "snotty" - that is very unappreciated especially since I'm a frequent traveller and have stayed in many many hotels and have never had such encounters with hotel staff. We were showed to our room which looked like a cabin rather than what they were aiming for : a modern room. Maybe it was modern decor and I just don't get it ! I don't know. NOT FOR ME. There is especially one serious problem with the restroom : you have the sink and the tub in one end of the room, and then a toilet all on its lonesome at the other end of the room......that would extremely inconvenient and made no sense to me either. Is that part of being modern too ? Apart from that, the rooms are big, beds are comfortable, sleep is good provided that the air conditioner works, balconies are wonderful...I am trying to find more positive things to say but I can't. I don't want to say the hotel is pretentious because it isn't, I'd say it is full of emptiness though ( no warmth ) and terrible staff. Thank God I didn't spend much time in the hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, good luxury at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: barbarab52
Reviews.Content: While the pool was single lane, the overall hotel was very pleasant and the staff was quite helpful. Balcony and rooftop are weak points .Overall good value for money

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel but could be noisy”
Reviews.Author: zimmermannm
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel..excellent service unfortunately smoking is allowed in the rooms.. can become smelly and also noisy is neighburgs are agitated!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable surroundings supported by an excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Mary_C04
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. The location is excellent due to its proximity to the Metro (which I needed to use to attend the conference in the outskirts of Barcelona [Sabadell]). The staff is extremely knowledgeable and attentive -- the best front desk service I've seen in a long, long time. The pool on the terrace is small, but the view from the terrace is fantastic. The restaurant was not quite as special as we were led to believe (based on reviews, etc.). Skip it and go instead to Drolma (in the Majestic Hotel) or The Petit Comite; the former is quite expensive, but the latter is more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “a hip and happening designer hotel right in the middle of barcelona”
Reviews.Author: amitanj
Reviews.Content: A hip and happening boutique hotel right in the centre of Barcelona... All attractions are walking distance.. the hotel takes the cake.. it is a very different and a pleasant experience.. conceirge quite helpful.. excellent add-ons in the room like music, i-pod dock etc.. excellent place to base yourself in barcelona...

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, but awesome style and wonderful restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MontoyaF1
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful, and the food we had a Mooita (the more casual of the two restaurants) was wonderful. In fact, it was one of the best meals we had while in Spain. Hotel Omm had to be one of my favorites for the decor of the room. This is minimalism at its best. However, it is very noisy; the balcony windows do not seal very well, so the noise of the outside traffic is pretty bad. Just bring some earplugs--it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant in a nice designer hotel”
Reviews.Author: Windcatcher
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here as part of a short visit to this vibrant city. Rooms were exactly the same as they were portrayed on the website. Beds were comfortable and lighting was pretty sexy. We ate at the hotel's restaurant, Moo. What a culinary treat! The concierge was rather cold.... but the service was impeccable. Perhaps, it was all part of being professional. Location of the hotel is rather ideal.... can't fault it especially when it has starbucks just across the street. All in all, a really nice hotel... nice ambience and worth a stay if you visit Barcelona and want a designer hotel to crash in.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: robinchristenson
Reviews.Content: Excellent design, amazing rooftop patio, impeccable service

Reviews.Title: “Modern Calm and Modern Energy”
Reviews.Author: beachbunny75
Reviews.Content: Everything the other reviews say about this hotel is true. The modern design is striking. The food is excellent. The bar is happening. The beds are comfortable. The lighting is difficult to operate. The service is good, but sometimes without a smile. The location is great for Gaudi, perhaps a little out of the way for the old town. Our reaction after experiencing it all first hand is that we really liked this hotel. I am glad we were warned about some of the less than stellar points, but we took it all in stride. After a full day of touring beautiful Barcelona, it was so nice to come back to our zen retreat. Upon arriving, we were offered a complimentary upgrade because a larger room was available for immediate occupancy. We really appreciated this after our 10 hour overseas journey. We had an excellent breakfast every morning in the lobby (very Euro with lots of cheese, juices, fresh breads and cold pork). I am sure it is not the best deal in town, but we liked it enough not to try and search another out. If you like modern architecture, the design of the lobby is inspiring at every turn. The lighting and music (of vast selection) set the perfect ambiance and that holds true in the guest rooms as well. (Yes, it is somewhat difficult to figure out which button does what, but not worth getting worked up about--except maybe for make-up application). The rooms seem very plain at first glance, but it made for a relaxing retreat. I thought the low beds were really comfortable. We loved our long and narrow balcony overlooking the courtyard. It might not have the greatest view (of the backs of some other apartment and office towers), but the vines hanging from above were an interesting solution and it was very quiet. We had one meal at Moo (try the tasting menus) and thought it was really special with an inventive menu and excellent service. Drinks afteward at the lobby bar is great for people watching. The basement disco was too much techno for us, but could be fun if you like to dance and hit the right DJ night. Our room was on the second floor and we could hear people coming and going late at night, but it was not terribly disrupting. If you are a light sleeper, the hallway noise could be an issue. The rooftop bar was heaven in the afternoon sun--very relaxing and with views of more than one Gaudi building. As for location, it is a bit of a hike to the old city (about a 10-15 minute walk to Placa Catalunya), but we enjoyed the exercise. The shopping in the immediate area is great for luxury goods. We found the service to be always helpful, though not quite as "butt-kissy" as some other hotels of similar price. Be prepared for direct answers to your requests without a lot of smiling. At the end of the day, the staff helped us with everything we needed and we had a great stay at the Omm

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy, but not for us...”
Reviews.Author: Mel1Sydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very trendy. We are not. It is a triumph of design over function. Or maybe we are just not cool enough to appreciate it (we have decided we are more Four Seasons type of people, if that helps understand my review). The entry is all stone and sharp lines, with a lobby bar with very low sofas and square tables which can double as seats. It is filled with beautiful young people on their Blackberrys, or scruffy film-looking types on their Macs. Very popular spot (thank goodness there was no loud music). The service was lackadaisical, but I’m not sure if that’s because everyone is so cool or just because they are Spanish! Or both. It’s meant to be a 5 star hotel, and may be so for a modern hotel, but not in our book. We had a 20 percent discount and were glad – it would have been very expensive and not worth the money to us without it. The corridors are all black (carpet, walls, ceilings) with “interesting” lighting; the rooms are comfortable enough (we had a junior suite #512 with a connecting interior room for our daughter, which meant it had no windows). They were a decent size, a good size, in fact. And at first glance, very funky and eclectic. Wooden floors, sliding doors between bedroom, shower stall, toilet (you have to walk past the basin section, then the shower section, to get to the toilet). The big king bed is very comfortable, but it has a canopy and frame – I bumped myself getting out of bed on the frame and the whole thing was quite creaky. So while it’s all very cool and angular with nooks and crannies and a mirror placed “just so” to give the room the appearance of being twice the size, the reality is that there is not enough closet space, the sofa is too low, the power points near the desk too low, there is nowhere to hang the robe (dressing gown) and the shower is inside the tub, which for some could prove difficult to get in and out of. There is also no clock. No free wifi, 2 free laptops available in the business centre in the basement. We found the front desk staff to be quite off-hand – that is, we expect more service and politeness for the money, but did give excellent restaurant recommendations. All in all, a very cool hotel, but expensive and not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish decor, nice turn-down service, great location, atrocious lighting design and very thin walls”
Reviews.Author: jazzroundmidnite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omm during the first half of our first trip to Barcelona for vacation. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay. As requested, we received a high-floor room away from the elevator with a balcony, which had a great view of the Gaudi house and the street. The hotel staff was friendly and seemed to be accommodating. Turn-down service was excellent. We received various tasty treats each day at sunset. Maid service was also good. The hotel was incredibly clean and the rooms were well-stocked. The rooms feature very modern/minimalist decor with nice TV/radio/MP3-compatible devices and wireless Internet was free and worked great. The location is also excellent, if you want to be in Eixample--right near a Metro stop and tons of shops/restaurants. The biggest disappointment is the functionality of the rooms. The layout, while visually striking, is not user friendly at all. The toilet is in a separate room, separated by the bed and a giant wall from the sink/shower. The walls are paper thin. You can hear everything that goes in the hallway and nearby rooms--make sure you get a room away from the elevator. The lighting proves to be the biggest drawback. You can only turn on and off the lights from switches next to one side of the bed. And to turn on the light in the toilet room, you have to turn on all the lights in the room. So, getting up to use the bathroom in the middle of the night is challenging. Overall, though, I would probably stay here again if I was able to get a high-floor room away from the elevator with a view of the Gaudi house.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel but the staff needs to understand they are not more important than the guests”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Gustafsson
Reviews.Content: Sometimes it strikes you; the staff think they are cooler than the guests and delivers a service that corresponds with their philosophy. It has happen before and will happen again that a strikingly fantastic hotel goes down the drain due to its staff. Watch out here management! There is actually not negative thing when it coms to; rooms, ambiance, location etc so in other words if you can live with a staff that isn't that attentive you re in good shape! Peter

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern hotel with excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelyari
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. it had a perfect location for shopping, sightseeing. Loved the staff, they gave us excellent recommendations. This will definetively be our hotel in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Spectacular Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ACVIANA
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Service was great and the restaurnat is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend in a glamorous but unflashy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Macbooklady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in a junior suite on the fourth floor. Huge four poster bed, large bathroom and dressing area, free wifi, flatscreen TV etc etc. The Omm is for you if you're a frequent traveller looking for a glamorous but low key hotel with good service and a wide range of facilities - a MIchelin starred restaurant, a spa, a rooftop terrace with pool and a nightclub. Everyone here is having a nice time in a cool, unflashy sort of way and the friendly and efficient young staff are all part of the vibe. The hotel is right next to all the power shopping on the Paseig de Gracia (the excellent Jofre Boutique is just next door) and there are great restaurants a short stroll away - I would recommend the hotel owners' Japanese restaurant nearby, or try the excellent Petit Comite for modern Catalan cooking, located in the same street. We had a lovely weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful room, shame about the attitude.”
Reviews.Author: MantySydney
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 6 nights at the Omm and had a very mixed experience. The hotel design is very sleek in design, almost over designed as working the lighting was a challenge! Our room was lovely, very spacious and once we sorted out the idosynchrasies of uber design we relaxed and enjoyed the space the room offered. The staff were very welcoming when we arrived but that is where the warmth ended. The rest of our experiences in the hotel left us wondering why a hotel that positions itself as five star would accept anything other than five star service. Surly, cold and snootish staff do nothing to add to the ambience of the hotel. We had arrived intending to eat in the Michelin star restaurant but decided that we would have a more enjoyable evening in another Madrid restaurant given the attitude of the floor staff in the lounge. A pity as the hotel is in a superb location, our room was terrific and the view from the roof top terrace absolutely worth enjoying with a glas of well chilled cava. Enjoy for the hotel and don't expect too much from the staff and the Omm is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Windynovember
Reviews.Content: A modern, trendy and stylish designer hotel in good location, comfortable and good size. A bit over price on food, but it would be good to try for once in the award winning restaurant. I would recommend to stay when the hotel doing the promotion.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming & disappointing in almost every way...not worth it”
Reviews.Author: busterbuster
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin....from the moment you walk in, there is not much of a hospitable vibe to this place. I live in London, and I love posh boutique hotels with an international flair...this perhaps looks the part, but very quickly you realise there is not much one you scratch the surface. The walls and the room doors are paper thin and not soundproof at all!! You can hear guests, but the worst part is that in the mornings you can hear the cleaning ladies who are nattering and yelling each other downt he hallways, vacuuming, etc and it will guarantee to wake you up...how can a 5 star hotel that charges upwards of EUR 300/night miss out on this crucial detail. Unacceptable.....and the only positive about the rooms is the awesome blackout shades...you can sleep for ages. Nice A/C as well, and my room had wireless, but in my friends' room - no wireless coverage. Fail. The bathroom & showers...poorly designed. Only a halfway glass partition, so without a shower curtain, the water gets everywhere. You can see the wood floor has water damage, and given that the bathroom is not enclosed, you don;t get a good steamy room for either steaming your clothes, or to have a nice steamy room for an after shower shave. The toiletries are in these unusable metal dispensers...also poorly designed. Room service - I ordered a tuna & asparagus salad which was delicious...but there was the tiniest morsel of tuna (like 3 tiny flakes), and one - yes ONE - spear of asparagus...and the salad was called a tuna & asparagus salad. Unbelievable. There is a hotel car parked out front...never offered a ride...what;s it for? The general hospitality of the staff is not great, which is typically a reflection of poor management - not much in terms of help or suggestions, etc. I also used the spa which was forgettable and i don;t really recommend it. The rooftop pool is tiny & underwhelming...hmmm, not great. Also, let it be known that the restaurant is shut in August, so was not able to check that out as well. I have no idea if the hotel bar/club was open cause no one at the hotel staff told us...and i could not be bothered to ask, so I ended up going to the Olympic Port near the Hotel Arts which is an area that is much much more happening in terms of cool bars, clubs and people. I would never stay here again...there has to be better places at better prices with significantly better attention to detail in construction and in staff. The irony is that Omm thinks its a hotel that is impeccably designed - it is anything but.

Reviews.Title: “Time for everything”
Reviews.Author: ErnestEllington
Reviews.Content: My last stay in Barcelona was do to my job. Fortunatley, Not only I was lucky with the hotel, but also it's location allowed me to do everything I had to, and even more! Located in the very Center of the city, next to one of the most important streets, Hotel Omm offers the chance of great mobility, it's in the middle of the city, so most ot the places you will have to go, will be equally far. The Best shops are rirght next to the hotel, Restaurants, clubs, etc. If you get tired of all the stuff in the city, or you are just too Lazzy, the hotel has it's own club, spa and 5 star cousine hotel. The Price, is of course above average, but if you can afford it, it is definetley worth it.

Reviews.Title: “UberCool”
Reviews.Author: jambu583
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that oozes class and coolness. One night stay for a short weekend in Barcelona...mainly to try out the Michelin-starred restaurant called Moo that is in the lobby of the hotel. My short getaway got off to a bad start when I missed my incoming flight so had to catch a later one. However, as soon as I got into the hotel, everything started to fall into place. I got upgraded to a junior suite. It was one of the best rooms I have stayed in! Very minimalist but done in a great way. From the shower, jacuzzi, bed...right to the huge projector tv that covers an entire wall! The automated curtains also kept out all sunlight when I needed to sleep. The pool on the top floor was very nice. It was packed though which is probably normal in summer. A little small...but then again, we are in a boutique hotel. Good service though by the two waitresses at the poolside bar. DInner was great. Moo was much smaller than I thought it would be but thoroughly deserved its Michelin star. Not too expensive as well. My only disappointment with the trip was that Ommsession was closed for renovations so I couldn't go there. To stay here, you would want to experience a certain type of holiday. Sometimes, the atmosphere in the lobby lounge might seem a little cold and not relaxed but as long as you get on with doing your own thing, then this shouldn't be a problem. Overall, a great stay at a great hotel. Awesome room!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Omm - Prime location”
Reviews.Author: lalaling
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Hotel Omm in Barcelona, Spain from June 15-19, 2009. We are a well-traveled couple accustomed to staying at 5 star hotels. We have discriminating tastes and tend to be critical. Our comments: Positives Location After much extensive research, we chose the Hotel Omm for its location. Located right off the Passeig de Gracia and a short walking distance from both Gaudi's La Pedera and Casa Battlo, the Hotel Omm is an excellent choice for it's prime location. There are plenty of cafés, tapas bars, interesting beautiful people watching and wonderful shopping located minutes away from the hotel. A Barcelona Turistic bus stop is also a 3-minute walk from the Hotel Omm. If you are visiting Barcelona for the first time, I highly recommend staying at a hotel located on Passeig de Gracia. Hotel Design As design aficionados, we liked the sleek, modern and overall look of the hotel. Our request for a room on the highest floor (6th floor) was fulfilled so our room was very quiet. We never heard any noise during our stay. Our request for early check-in was also granted. We stayed in a non-smoking Standard King room and took advantage of the 4-night stay promotion which we booked on Expedia. Our room was spacious and filled with plenty of light. The overall feel of the room is very minimalist and stylish. We had a view of an interior courtyard; nothing great but at least it provided plenty of light. I really liked the 2 pre-mixed CDs included with the CD player. The room also smelled lovely. Many other trip advisor reviewers complained about the lighting system but we found it to be fine and quite manageable. We loved the bathrooms and there was plenty of space for our toiletries. A complimentary bottle of water along with tasty chocolates were also provided daily by the hotel. Housekeeping does an excellent job. Our hotel room was always cleaned and replenished with fresh towels when we returned back to our room which was usually 4-7:00 pm. Front Desk Service The front desk members were all very attentive, polite, warm and friendly. We found them to be very helpful and patient with all of our questions/requests. I noted that after the first day, the daily bottle of water/chocolates were no longer being provided. As soon as I brought this issue to their attention, it was remedied right away. One evening, a staff member walked us to the corner of the street to help us hail a cab for dinner. One night, a front desk member printed out a street map so that we could walk to the Palacio de Flamenco for our show. Another time, a hotel staff member opened up the business center at 12:30 am so that we could use the computers. Overall, we were provided with excellent service at the front desk. Roof top From the roof top/pool area, you have a magnificent view of the rooftop warriors of La Pedera. It makes for a fabulous photo op. Negatives Uncomfortable Bed Unfortunately, the bed was not comfortable. As customary in Europe, a King size bed means putting 2 double size mattresses together. Since all the beds are platform beds, the mattress just was not plush enough for us. Since we have back issues, every morning we woke up with sore/stiff back and necks. We would have been happier with thicker/memory foam mattresses. We have platform beds at home with Tempurpedic mattresses which are far more comfortable than the bed we had at Hotel Omm. Rude Hotel Bartender On a Tuesday night, we had drinks at the hotel lobby bar after dinner. We were shocked by the incredibly RUDE bartender who sneered at us after taking our drink orders and threw our drinks on our table with such disdain. While serving us, he barely glanced at us. He has a goatee and a slick ponytail; he definitely fit the "look" of the trendy hotel bar. Although good looking, he obviously must be a frustrated soccer player/model/actor wannabee. We were by the far the best dressed couple in the hotel lobby and yet he treated us like street riff raff and not paying hotel guests. In fact, we made a point to write on the bar bill "No Tip - Bad Service" in both English and Spanish. During checkout, I also made it a point to tell the front desk how rudely we were treated by the bartender and that it’s a comment that I personally read several times on Trip Advisor and that the hotel manager should be aware of this issue. The second time we had drinks at the hotel bar, we had a female bartender who was much nicer. Overall Asides from the uncomfortable bed and very RUDE bartender, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We didn’t eat at the hotel. Although the menus looked appealing it was a bit too expensive. The restaurant is a gorgeous space and frequented by well heeled locals. We also didn't have a chance to check out the spa which also looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Omm”
Reviews.Author: pastular18
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and comfortable hotel with a sexy bar, restaurant and roof top pool. Perfect location close to great shopping and tapas (go to Bar Mut around the corner). Fast, free wireless internet. We had the standard room and it was lovely and the view of La Pedrera was magical. The staff was helpful and friendly and the beautiful bartenders gave us advice on which nightclub to go to (Opium Mar in Port Olympic) and which beach to visit (beaches up north). The last part of our trip was spent at Hotel Miramar in Montjuic which is up on a hilltop with views of the city. The combination of these two hotels provided a rich experience of Barcelona in the short four nights we had to spend. Be sure to visit Parc Guell during your stay...it is a Gaudi magical fantasy.

Reviews.Title: “well-located, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikefromKentucky
Reviews.Content: The Omm is an ultra-modern hotel with a great location. About a 15 minute walk from Plaza de Catalyuna and La Rambla and within easy walking distance of several Gaudi structures. (La Pedrera is across the street). Hop on-Hop off tour bus stops out front (but tickets must be initially validated at the Plaza de Catalyuna). We paid 180 euros per night for a seven-night stay, well below the published rate. The hotel has a small rooftop pool and spa and a highly regarded restaurant (Moo). We didn't eat there because it is very expensive. Room rates do not include breakfast but there are several good breakfast spots within a five-minute walk. Several good and relatively inexpensive restaurants as well. Our favorite tapas bar is the Cerveseria Catalan, two blocks down the Passeig and then two blocks to the right on Mallorca. Hotel also has free internet in the business center. The only problem we had was getting our bottled drinking water delivered to the room at night: had to call the front desk to get the maid to get it to our room. This shouldn't happen at an expensive hotel. But otherwise this is very nice, comfortable, well-located hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing designer hotel”
Reviews.Author: joycekwong
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and had a balcony room facing the back quad. It was quiet and comfortably, quite homely. The spa is fantastic but pricey. Must go up to roof top where there is a pool and you can see Gaudi's Pedrara on the next block. We tried some of their chain restaurants outside the hotel and they were great as well. Will definitely come back to Barcelona and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fab design and awesome rooms!”
Reviews.Author: virgo_08
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at Hotel OMM in May. Getting there - cab from the airport. Its around 22 euros - we had 2 large bags so that added a few to the bill. Location - right on Passeg de Gracia in the posh Eixample district. Its a bit away from the more touristy Rambla, and in a way more peaceful. The metro stop is right outside, so if you want to take that around, very convenient. But a quick tip here - if there are two or more of you traveling, don't bother with the Metro. The way to see the city is above the ground, and cabs are very cheap. Rooms - are very spacious. Barcelona is an expensive city - we paid around 240 Euros for a very large superior room. I think this was by far the best hotel room during our 3 week long trip to Spain. Hotel amenities - there is so much to do in Barcelona that we didn't get a chance to check out their famous restaurant - Moo. We did have drinks at the hotel one night, and was fun. Also ordered room service one night - prompt, efficient and delicious. So what is the summary? If you have the budget, you can' t go wrong with the Omm.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool”
Reviews.Author: LondonMerlot
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Service and greeting really friendly. Very trendy sexy hotel. If you want a romantic weekend it definitely is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: trip4visor
Reviews.Content: Located at the end of passeig de gracia shopping area, this is a very modern and cool hotel. I didn't like the open-air bathroom, but I appreciated the quality of material and design of the hotel. I didn't tried the restaurant because of very high prices and not so impressed by the breakfast (at charge). The small disco club downstairs is a nice option, but not the best in town. The staff is young and friendly but not so professional in my opinion. This is a great start to explore Barcellona (casa Mila is next door and visible from rooftop) and have some shopping in the surroundings. You can easily catch a taxi from the hotel or using the subway station in few steps away. Don't miss the lunch in Barceloneta at Merendero de la mar

Reviews.Title: “Ommmmlicious”
Reviews.Author: Rachelp77
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hotel. After reading some of the previous reviews I was worried about pretentious staff, noise and shady rooms - we experienced none of these! The staff were helpful and polite and didn't seem at all pretentious. The rooms were extremely comfortable, with a wonderful bathroom, great lighting and comfy bed. We really enjoyed the use of the spa - and most the time had this completely to ourselves. Restaurant Moo was superb, food was fantastic and I would highly recommend going - as it really is an experience of fantastic food. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “all fur coat and no knickers”
Reviews.Author: sallylovesibiza
Reviews.Content: Best bit about this hotel is the location. Rooms are small with a broken bed. the lighting in the room atrocious with the hotel builders thinking that having automated curtains made up for not having usual necessities such a light switches. Never been to a 5 star hotel that thinks it is enough to just provide the sound system, and 2 cd's. No DVD player, no music or film catalgoue. A hotel for people who want to be seen in the "cool" places and wil pay over the odds for the priveledge of this. Staff were sullen beyond the initial check in smiles. Would not recommend this hotel. Don't waste your money unless you are only interested in style over content.

Reviews.Title: “an issue of attitude”
Reviews.Author: Franz21
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 4-day trip to Barcelona with my girlfriend and we stayed at the Hotel Omm. The hotel is fantastic: great design, spacious rooms, a lot of natural light, very comfortable bed, plenty of storage space; high-quality toiletries etc. As noted in other reviews, the room soundproofing is quite poor, which can be an issue with light sleepers, but I could not single out any other flaws in the building. The location is excellent, close to all major attractions, but still sufficiently far away from the burst and chaos of Las Ramblas. There is a glamorous atmosphere (especially in the bar and club) and it definitely is a place where (supposedly) fashionable people like to be seen. If you like the genre, this is the place for you. What we did not like was the service, indifferent at best. After a first good welcome people at the reception did not almost even bother to say hi again. Some of the staff were really nice, but overall the attitude was predominantly snobbish and limited to doing the very minimum. Nothing of the extra care you normally find in good hotels. Some of the staff were just so pretentious it looked as if we were there to please them and no vice-versa. Overall, it's a place to see and we enjoyed our stay but we won't definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Made us welcomm....”
Reviews.Author: cheryltheperil
Reviews.Content: This is a very smart design hotel, but it does what it does very well. Great rooms with all the amenities you would expect for a hotel at this end of the market, and we also had a balcony. The rooms are serviced twice a day so there are always plenty of fresh towels, replenished toiletries etc. The staff were friendly but there does appear to be a door policy for the bar at night - although as a resident they obviously let you in, but we did see plenty of non-residents turned away. Samuel Eto'o didn't appear to have any trouble though! Our breakfast wasn't included in the hotel rate so we only ate there once - at 23.50 euros per person you need to make sure you are hungry. Having said that, it was very nice, and as it is served until 11.30 each morning, you can take your time. As others have mentioned, the location is superb for shopping, eating and sightseeing. If you want to eat in the hotel restaurant, Moo, you need to book in advance as it has a very good reputation, and so consequently was fully booked before we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel! very schiki”
Reviews.Author: frankwoods68
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to stay at this hotel. It was worth staying at it. We enjoyed parties and the events we were invited at. The hotel is EXCELLENT and the location is in the main avenue De Grazia. Its near everywhere and very nice to take a walk during night. Definetly we are going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel, Indiferent service”
Reviews.Author: RICNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Omm for 4 days. The hotel design is great, nice lobby, cool bedrooms, beautiful spa and roof terrace. Even though the hotel is clasified as a 5 star, I personally think it should be a 4 star due to the indifferent and sometimes snobby service. There were some employees that were very nice, but the vast majority weren't. They did their job.....yes, but never smiled or went out of their way to be nice. The bar scene is cool, but as a hotel guest you do not get treated well, as you don't get seating preference and the bar staff is pretentious. We also had phone problems and no hot water in the shower! In summary, the hotel is beautiful, well located and definitely a cool place to stay, but my main complain is the service.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: PDickinson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here - although hotel is very smart, staff were extremely rude. My wife got food poisoning after eating in the hotel restaurant and, after a night without sleep, we were told we could not check-out late and had to vacate the room. I was also told to move away from the bar area when I walked back into the hotel lobby after being outside all day (as I was wearing shorts!).

Reviews.Title: “Oh yes ommmmmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: dodasek
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend went to barcelona at the beginning of October and stayed there 4 days. Hotel an absolute revelation. Service is brilliant - enything we asked about, including DVD late at night on Sunday, dry cleaning - was made very fast. Service more than nice, they recomended delicious tapas bar and were very halpful. Room stunning, we both loved it. Just enough for 2, very clean, good chocolates at the evening waiting on bed every night. Also Omm CD suprised us positively and we even bought one. What's more, restaurant downstairs have one Michellin star. Did not have chance to try it, but we will next time for sure, as we're planning to stay in OMM every -next time :) GRAT location, right in the center, one block from popular Ghaudi building.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great service!”
Reviews.Author: jobymaloby
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything! It is in a superb location, it is very smart, and the staff are excellent. I found the design really impressive, without being design for designs sake. The staff were really helpful and not at all pretentious as others have said. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable and the public areas (bar, pool, roof terrace) are places you want to hang out in. I go to Barcelona frequently and this is definately now my hotel of choice. I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good but pretentiousGood but pretentious.”
Reviews.Author: JCLON
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, the building is impressive, especially the restaurant and bar area. The room was nice however it is a little loud and is not maintained to “brand new” condition as you would expect of this type of property. The staff is a little pretentious but efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Uber cool”
Reviews.Author: t_patsalides
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in Barcelona, the Omm was everything I wanted from a top rate boutique hotel, I had a superior room and the size and facilities were excellent, separate bathroom and wet room, electronic gadgetry to control lighting, blinds etc.... Unfortunately the restaurant was closed but the fantastic bar more than made up for it, very knowledgable bar staff, especially Lenka who was lovely. The nearby Tragaluz restaurant (only 100 metres away) was fantastic and part of the same group. Service at reception was friendly and professional and the rooftop bar and pool were a welcome retreat in the late afternoon when recovering from shopping and sightseeing. Will definetly be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “A different hotel”
Reviews.Author: feriefan
Reviews.Content: The upsides: - very different from the usual hotels, very cool and a quite nordic style - the staff was very friendly, even though it was an expensive hotel - Obviously a popular nightclub and great drinks - great roof terrace with a wonderful view and a pool The downsides: - Not soundproof at all, you could hear other people in the corridor very clearly - The toilet and the bathroom was separate, you had to walk through the bedroom to wash your hands

Reviews.Title: “cool spot in a hot city”
Reviews.Author: stannn
Reviews.Content: centrally located in a high rent stretch of the city, this is a decent joint. public areas are stylish and comfortable - there was a fashion shoot taking place as i checked in. rooms are well designed and comfortable. i couldn't find the minibar it was so well designed and hidden - but was assured that it existed. request a room overlooking the street on a high floor, away from the lift and with a balcony. the rooftop pool/ bar is what this hotel is about. the pool is pretty small but its more for a refreshing dip than a workout. its a nice space to lounge about in high above the hustle and bustle of the city. drawback include getting twin beds rather than a double, and the noise of vacuum cleaners banging off the door in the morning. the continental breakfast was poor and rather overpriced. on a side issue, be very vigalent at all times in the city. friends got attacked when travelling by taxi from the airport. the taxi doors were unlocked and opened when stopped at traffic lights. thieves snatched a handbag from the back seat. when reporting the crime, the police station was full of tourists reporting similar incidences.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: shinds
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite, which turned out to have hardly any natural light, and the room lighting was minimal, except for the bedside light that never switched off. Ordered tea to the room on arrival, after 45 mins wait, phoned thru to be told curtly we have to still wait..! Arrived with no milk, and the hot water in a thermos marked coffee, therefore hot water was somewhat contaminated. The spa and gym closed 4 hrs early with no explanation when we went to reception to enquire why. Disgrace of a gym, should not be allowed to call it that (friend I was with is on a training program and needed facilities). So we checked out after one night, and an argument over ability to check out as they said we had used an agent to book thru so therefore commission was payable, when we had used their website on advise from their own booking staff. Definitely not 5 *. Go to Majestic, or as we did Hotel Arts. Now they are 5*

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheb1978
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to the metro and shops, and walking distance to downtown Barcelona (if you don't mind a good 10-15 minute walk). If you're looking for a modern hotel then this is defnitely one you should look at. The rooms were smaller than we expected although the size is probably standard for European hotels. Staff was friendly (and English speaking which is definitely a plus) but their knowledge of the area wasn't what we expected. We asked for the nearest Catholic Church and the staff seemed confused and pointed us toward the Cathedral downtown (there was a Church down the block). The restaurant downstairs was interesting... can't really say good or bad, but can definitely say interesting... All in all, a little expensive for what we got, but because the location was so great, we couldn't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst five star service ever”
Reviews.Author: marr
Reviews.Content: Main reason to choose such hip hotel over the New Year period was to have the highest possible level of service in hotel including recommendations and reservations for restaurants out of the hotel. They lacked with both. Hotel itself looks nice, since it was New Year period it was full but it only consists of around 60 rooms. It is part of group Tragaluz which owns around 13 bars and restaurants around Barcelona. On every single request for recommendation and reservation for any of these restaurants they were completely not interested in help, they even didn’t bother to call any of their restaurants and ask for a table, whatever we asked answer was the same: no. Even for their own bar hey didn’t allow us to use empty tables claiming that they are for dinner, for the rest of the evening tables were empty and no other place to sit as hotel bar is hip place in Barcelona, or at least want to be. We used SPA once and they told us that we can not use all the areas, we complained and their reply was be happy that we stayed open for you, it is new year day. Unbelievable. Bathroom amneties were broken throught our stay, nobody bothered to change them. Absolute climax was last night when we ordered tea in room, first we waited for around 30 minutes, strange for a hotel with 60 rooms. I called and lady told me that she forgot, then in another 15 min she brought tea but without honey, I called again and she brought honey, I complained about service and she told me that staff is aware of the problems but she is the only one working in room service and left. I took honey but it seemed strange, it was soy sauce. I talked to manager we were given last night as complimentary, and no room service was charged. Hotel manager was very nice, polite and professional guy obviously aware of the hotel problems. To me this was the worst service I encountered in 5 star hotels ever.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tc_soho
Reviews.Content: My husband was in Barcelona for a sales conference and trade show. I happily tagged along for the week long trip. We stayed at Hotel Condes de Barcelona for the first half of the trip, then moved to Hotel Omm for the second half. Although both properties offered comfortable accommodations and were centrally located (two blocks apart from each other), Hotel Omm's attention to detail and really swanky/cool atmosphere made it a much more enjoyable and luxurious place to stay. I would recommend having drinks in the lobby along with all the fashionable people in Barcelona (mix of international and locals). Then have a soak in the deep tub with views of the city (they provide bath salts as an amenity) before hitting the town for dinner at 10pm like the locals! Before bed, you will find two gourmet chocolates on your pillow in a sweet little gift box, plus two bottles of water - always a plus! In the morning, definitely splurge on the buffet breakfast where you can have all the iberican ham, spanish cheese, and cava you can handle. Yummm! There is also parking under the hotel (not sure what the charge is) and the internet is free - another plus! The staff was extremely helpful and they all spoke English. I would definitely come back here again and recommend it to all my friends. PS - We didn't get a chance to use the pool b/c January is pretty cool in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality materials and tiredness in general.”
Reviews.Author: Ladymann
Reviews.Content: New Year in Barcelona! Great idea. Omm spa is excellent and reasonable. Staff are brilliant if a little 'stiff' at first. We joined in for the €250 x 2 dinner on New Year's eve and it simply wasn't up to either the hype or price. The food was just not any more than average. The waiters forgot one wine accompaniment. The breakfast was nice indeed and very low key but one of the best. Lots of fresh fruit, and tapa style elements. Now the bad stuff and where this place fails... The rooms are nice in concept but cheap materials are now starting to let the place down and badly. The walls were marked and the tables chipped. Also, the shower and toilet are on one side of a large partition and the bathroom and washbasins were on the other side . Go to the loo and you either use the bidet to ablute or schlep around to the bathroom. The interior designers need to be dragged back in to see how their concept is working (or not). Thus, the room was very disappointing indeed and minimal is confused with 'cheap'. The water in the shower was constantly warmish (but never enough) at a push and the shower attachment on the bath-side leaked water onto a wooden floor. Additionally, we went for a walk after dinner and the goons on the hotel door were exceptionally rude ( a la guest list manner one finds on LA) when we returned and said we were staying there... We stay in Barcelona many times a year and there are better options of higher standard and quality available.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a disappointment....”
Reviews.Author: Littlemissblondie
Reviews.Content: We booked the Omm for the first three nights of our honeymoon having seen the review for it in the European Mr & Mrs Smith guide. We're big fans of Mr & Mrs Smith and have stayed at a number of their recommended hotels. This was one fine - big, fairly anonymous, sleek scandinavian type design - but there was nothing about it that made it stand out. The lobby, bar & restaurant are great and definitely worth a visit. The rooms however are fairly average. There are some nice touches (compliation CDs in the room, mood lighting) but the whole place feels a bit clinical and unwelcoming. The staff were fine but largely uninterested and after we complained about a couple of things on the night we arrived (we had a balcony room overlooking some wasteland and apartments with underwear hanging outside), we felt there was a bit of a atmosphere....not what you expect or want when you're paying over £200 per night!! We had the same issue as someone else with the iron! The hotel said they weren't able to provide an iron but could iron clothes for us and then presented us with a bill for this! The hotel is situated in one of the more upmarket areas of Barcelona amidst a lot of designer shops. It depends what you're looking for but with hindsight, we prefer the Gothic Quarter where there are more trendy bars and places to eat. In summary....the OMM is OK but there are better places in gorgeous Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, good vibe, but we've stayed in better...”
Reviews.Author: paperback
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long trip to Barcelona. We stayed at the Omm for three nights over the weekend. I read about in in Travel and Leisure and thought it would be worth the try. We usually stay at Condes de Barcelona, and we like to stay in the Eixample, a clean and beautiful part of Barcelona. The Omm is a bit pretentious, is similar to a W hotel in style, but is not the most comfortable or friendly place we have stayed. The staff were nice, but do not go out of the way for you. There is no concierge. Door staff are there but sometimes do not bother to notice you. The rooms are nice, cool functional design, although small. Beds are very comfortable. The spa is average. The best thing about the hotel is the lobby. Very comfortable, always people. The restaurant Moo is fabulous, one the most impressive dinners we have ever had. Make reservations weeks ahead!! All in all, a nice comfortable stay in the best area in town. Don;t go expecting great attentive service, but do expect a great lobby and lounge, a great location, and fantastic food.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KLAXERN25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July and loved it! We had a fantastic bedroom (we stayed in a superior room). The curtains, TV, Lights etc. were all controlled by a panel in the headboard making it easier than ever to be lazy and relax. It was the most comfortable bed I've slept in for a long time! Two bathrooms, both beautifully equipped with the usual luxury toiletries and robes. Complementary CDs of chill out music and a nice balcony to sit and enjoy the evening sun. We LOVED the completely black corrider with neon floor lighting to guide you, it was like some sort of fantasy land! Also made good use of the roof terrace as it was hot. Yes, the pool is smallish and unheated but it was lovely and relaxing with great views. A respite from the city heat. We found the staff really friendly and helpful, making reservations for us and generally giving advice. The bar area was cool and quite packed at night. We didn't try the nightclub though. As my husband is a real foodie so we had a meal at Moo. All was good but I would give it a miss unless you are really into innovative food as you have to order 5 or 6 courses each and they're all quite small. I finshed off with smoke flavoured ice cream which was presented with a chocolate cigar in an ashtray. It actually tasted like a dirty ashtray and not for the faint hearted! All in all we really enjoyed our stay and I would recommend it in terms of luxury accommodation and a great location in Barcelona.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Omm
HotelInfo.Address: Rosello 265, 08008 Barcelona, Spain
